sn4.10:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn4.10:5.1: “Mendicants, the life span of humans is short.
sn4.10:5.2: You must go to the next life. So you should do what is skillful, you should practice the spiritual life.
sn4.10:5.4: A long life is a hundred years or a little more.”
sn4.10:6.1: The Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha
sn4.10:6.2: went up to him and addressed him in verse:
sn4.10:7.1: “The days and nights don’t rush by,
sn4.10:7.3: The life of mortals keeps rolling on,
sn4.10:7.4: like a chariot’s rim around the hub.”
sn4.10:8.2: and then life is cut short.
sn4.10:8.3: The life of mortals wastes away,
sn4.10:8.4: like the water in tiny streams.”
sn4.10:9.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The Buddha knows me! The Holy One knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
